name: charming

B1 pleasant and attractive: We had dinner with our director and his charming wife. What a charming street this is.

disapproving used to describe people who use their attractiveness to influence people or to make other people like them: He's very charming but I wouldn't trust him.
disapproving often humorous used to show that you do not approve of what someone has said or done: "Shut up, will you, I'm trying to watch TV!" "Oh, charming!"
More examplesFewer examplesThey live in a charming old cottage.I think her naivety is charming - she's so unspoilt and fresh.He's suave, polished and charming.He's very charming but I wouldn't trust him as far as I could throw him.Jim was remarkably charming this evening - he even said, unprompted, how nice Margot looked in her dress.
